column3:
A missing library?

The unrecognized option is harmless and probably unrelated.
The code changes look good to me.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/d282c1fb64ae570caab951247e6ead4b9059043d for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
@diapolo Is this ready for merging?\n(the opening post still says this is only a preview)\n
It is final, and I did test it on Win7 and Win8.1. If you would like to get more feedback, we need testers here. You checked the code and it looks good, yes?\n
@Diapolo Ok, just asking, I was just about to merge this and then I saw the 'do not merge' warning. \n
As this is windows shutdown specific, let's move this function to winshutdownmonitor.cpp instead.\n

Indeed a good idea. Also I need to find the best place to call `registerShutdownBlockReason()` as I seem to have lost that call after you reworked the startup to be an own thread ^^. Before I was using this for months, but didn't have time to create a pull for testing and comments.\n
